title: Add Nigerian digital banks and fintechs to withdrawal payout bank list

requirements.text: Expand the Nigerian bank options used for withdrawal payout methods to include Kuda Bank, OPay, Moniepoint, and PalmPay, and broaden the list to cover Nigerian online/digital banking options so users can select them during payout method creation.

quotes: Add Kuda bank opay moniepoint ,palm-pay add all Nigeria online banking for payment withdraw

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/config/nigerianBanks.ts` includes entries for: "Kuda Bank", "OPay", "Moniepoint", and "PalmPay" (spelled as user-facing names).
The updated list remains the single source of truth used by `NigerianBankSelect`, and the new entries appear in bank search results when typing queries like "kuda", "opay", "monie", and "palm".

Users can successfully add a payout method selecting any of these new options from the searchable dropdown in both the Withdrawals flow and the Send-to-Bank sheet, with no UI crashes or validation dead-ends.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture; do not introduce additional canisters or external services.
nonGoals: Implementing real payment rails, bank transfers, or third-party payout integrations for Kuda/OPay/Moniepoint/PalmPay.
Adding third-party authentication or wallet integrations.
Changing backend withdrawal/payout schemas unless strictly required for the bank list update (not expected).
